[h1]Half-life as a series: For the late arrivals[/h1]

My friend has recommended the Half-life series to me since 2012 (I can't be sure but it might have been the first thing he said when we met). 

I bought the whole series a year later.... and let it sit in my library for 5 years.

In that time:
[list]
[*]I have watched several playthroughs of the series
[*]I have had every level and plot point spoiled and discussed in depth.
[*]I have experienced every gun and enemy in gmod
[/list]

After all of this, I should have felt that the experience was ruined. Right?

[b]IT WAS STILL GREAT. PLAY THESE GAMES.[/b]

This year, I finally decided to play the whole series in one shot. I regret not having played it sooner because it was a joy to play.

Despite the age. 
Despite the spoiled plot. 
Despite being familiar with the guns and enemies. 

The experience truely was more that the sum of its parts.

Do yourself a favor and play these games. There is no rush. Half-life will still be good for a long time. But if you have the time, enjoy the series and an experience like no other.

Last year I nominated this game for the "Game Most Deserving Of A Sequel" award, and I am happy do it again for 2017. 
If you have not played this, Half Life 2:E2 is the game that left the story on a cliffhanger never to be finished. However do not let that deter you from enjoying this masterpiece. The graphics hold up to this day and the gameplay is hard to find in this day and age.

[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

PLEASE NOTE (2017): Due to recent false accusations of plagarism, I (the reviewer) would like to stress that all these reviews and upcoming reviews are original and are not blatantly copied. Other reviews are used to help stress my point across but are changed in such a way to make the review in my own wording [/h1]

[b] THE [i] (possible) [/i] FINALE TO ONE OF THE BEST PC GAMES OF ALL TIME [/b]

This game is still awesome and fun to play even to this day, Half-Life 2: Episode Two still stays one of the best FPS games on the PC. Released way back in 2006, Half-Life 2: Episode Two was developed by Valve and originally published by Sierra Studios but now is self-published by Valve themselves and is a continuation to the widely popular Half-Life 2 and the first epsiode in the episodic series; Half-Life 2: Episode One

Half-Life 2: Episode Two offers solid controls with an interestingly told story and some interesting settings and unforgettable characters. The game is difficult and you will die a lot but with a little patience you will get through its 8 or so hour campaign

Half-Life 2: Episode Two offers some good level design with a modding community which is still alive to this very day! And the game runs smoothly and runs fine on modern-day systems

And who of course forget the famous crowbar!

Incredibly, for a game that came out in 2006, the game's graphics and sound design have really aged well and you can tell if the game came out nowadays or in 2006 and with the Source engine, it has aged the game very well and has made it playable on almost every modern PC to date

Half-Life 2: Episode Two is an instant classic and a must buy for every PC owner and may be the last we will ever get to see of Gordon, Alyx and the rest of the characters from the Half-Life universe...
 
[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!) [/i]
